SUMMARY: MazF is a toxin that is counteracted by MazE antitoxin [8650219]. mazEF system causes a programmed cell death response to stresses including starvation [8650219] and antibiotics [11222603]. antitoxin, MazE, is subject to degradation by ClpP-ClpA protease complex and exhibits a short (30 minute) half life, whereas toxin, MazF, is much more stable [8650219]. structure of MazE-MazF complex is presented at 1.7 A resolution [12718874]. complex is hexameric and is comprised of a MazE homodimer sandwiched between MazF homodimers [12718874]. Review: [12718870, 21927020].
